result.execSummary:
The defendant Canyon Myles Marcelain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
May not have contact with Travis V or Jemal T, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney P Flanagan. Clerk/H. Barnett. Court imposes a total sentence of 17 years WSP concurrent to 13CF128:  9 years initial confinement w/credit for 600 days served; 8 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge. No contact with Travis V. or Jemal T.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Canyon Myles Marcelain appeared with Attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  case heard with co-def 16CF8.      ST called witness KPD Det. Mark Poffenberger ; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Caspari and Atty Rufo. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Both DE's have filed substitution of Br 3; tab pulled for Br 6. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  DA Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
by DE of Br 3; tab pulled for Br 6.
Diane Caspari  kmk
